title: XYZ-Wing
description: Extend XY-Wing pattern with an additional candidate for complex eliminations

steps.title: Extended Chains
steps.content:
Learn **XYZ-Wing** - an extension of XY-Wing with 3 candidates in pivot.

**What You'll Learn:**
- XYZ-Wing structure (3-candidate pivot)
- How it differs from XY-Wing
- Finding and applying XYZ-Wings

**Time Estimate:** 35 minutes

steps.title: XYZ-Wing Pattern
steps.content:
**XYZ-Wing Structure:**
- **Pivot cell**: Has candidates {X, Y, Z}
- **Pincer 1**: Has candidates {X, Z}
- **Pincer 2**: Has candidates {Y, Z}

**Key Difference from XY-Wing:**
Pivot has 3 candidates instead of 2, but still connects to 2 pincers.

**The Logic:**
If pivot is X ‚Üí sees Pincer 1 {X,Z}, so Pincer 1 = Z
If pivot is Y ‚Üí sees Pincer 2 {Y,Z}, so Pincer 2 = Z
If pivot is Z ‚Üí pivot itself is Z
Either way, Z appears in one of the 3 cells.

**Elimination:**
Any cell that SEES all three cells (pivot + both pincers) cannot be Z.

**Requirements:**
- Pivot with 3 candidates
- 2 pincers with 2 candidates each
- All 3 cells share one candidate (Z)
- Target sees all 3 cells

options: Requires tracking 3-candidate cells and complex chains
